name: Subacute Thyroiditis
chief_complaint: Painful neck swelling and fever for the past 2 weeks
prognosis: Self-limiting condition typically resolving within 3-6 months, though may progress through hyperthyroid, hypothyroid, and recovery phases
description: Subacute granulomatous thyroiditis (De Quervain's) is an inflammatory thyroid condition likely post-viral, characterized by painful thyroid enlargement and transient thyrotoxicosis followed by hypothyroidism before eventual recovery. Imaging shows patchy thyroid involvement.
